greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of z-trees summing to n. Number of connected strict integer partitions of n with pairwise indivisible parts and clutter density -1.
comment: Given a finite set S of positive integers greater than one, let G(S) be the simple labeled graph with vertex set S and edges between any two vertices with a common divisor. For example, G({6,14,15,35}) is a 4-cycle. A multiset S is said to be connected if G(S) is a connected graph.
The clutter density of a multiset S of positive integers is Sum_{s in S} (omega(s) - 1) - omega(LCM(S)).
link: R. Bacher, On the enumeration of labelled hypertrees and of labelled bipartite trees, arXiv:1102.2708 [math.CO].
example: The a(30) = 8 z-trees together with the corresponding multiset systems are the following.
results.author: _Gus Wiseman_, May 21 2018
